title: Ibis-Form Mummy in Jar
description: Mummified ibis, crudely wrapped, in open-topped conical pottery jar. The mummy is incomplete; it contains a few stray bones, such as a vertebrae.

museum_location.name: This item is not on view

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 37.1952Ea-c, 14.656a-b
labels.content: Ceramic jars were common, inexpensive coffins for animal mummies. There were two types of lids. In the first, a lid for an ordinary jar could be fashioned from mud and straw. In the second, an opening could be made in the jar while the clay was still wet; both the jar and its cover could then be fired together.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

exhibitions.title: Soulful Creatures: Animal Mummies in Ancient Egypt
